DataElement.preferredName: MD Anderson Symptom Inventory Person Complete by Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the person who filled out the MD Anderson Symptom Inventory instrument.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: MD Anderson Symptom Inventory - Core Person Complete
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms._A human being._To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A self-administered questionnaire designed to assess multiple symptoms experienced by cancer patients and the interference with daily living caused by these symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: Person; a human being.:Complete; having every necessary or normal part or component or step; or having come or been brought to a conclusion.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Patient  with caregiver assistance to enter data

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.: The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.: The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
Used to indicate the presence of something or someone.
The primary person in charge of the care of a patient, usually a family member or a designated health care professional.
The act of contributing to the fulfillment of a need or furtherance of an effort.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Freedom from control or influence of another or others factors.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.
To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Freedom from control or influence of another or others factors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
